result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerardo Abelardo Sanchez-Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerardo Abelardo Sanchez-Hernandez

defendant.name: Sanchez-Hernandez, Gerardo Abelardo
defendant.address: W1573 Aspen Avenue, Pine River, WI 54965

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:20 pm case called. Defendant Gerardo Abelardo Sanchez-Hernandez in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Enrique Soria appears and is sworn by Court.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and permissible punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  GP entered.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   Sentencng argument by DA Blader. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 45 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. To be served Forthwith. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Case Called @ 3:04 PM: Defendant Gerardo Abelardo Sanchez-Hernandez not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  In light of nonappearance Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court also orders forfeiture of cash bond previousl posted.
